question.content:
**Order the side lengths of the triangle from shortest to longest.**

[[☃ sorter 1]]


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4d52a4fb9aea5b60af541112181bd005680684d9)

*Note: Figure not necessarily drawn to scale.*

hints.content:
**Key idea:** The longest side of a triangle is always opposite that triangle's largest angle.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5c11e320c2ad7d553af4b438cb316bf103a3796e)

Play around with the triangle below to verify this key idea.

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]
Side $c$ is the longest side because it is opposite the largest angle.
Side $a$ is the shortest side because it is opposite the smallest angle.

The side lengths are ordered from shortest to longest:

 | | |
- | - | -
$a$ | $b$ | $c$

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]
Angle $B$ is the largest angle because the longest side is opposite it.
Angle $A$ is the smallest angle because the shortest side is opposite it.

The angles are ordered from smallest to largest:

 | | 
- | - | -
$A$ | $C$ | $B$
